channel.title: walking on Sheena Cook
channel.description: Recent content in walking on Sheena Cook

item.title: Derbyshire Details
item.description: A steadiness as that river flows Tree colours natural heraldry Swimming swagger of trout River festival of ducks, geese, gulls The sky a blue canvas Clouds roil in a temporary grey Cattle graze a placid Autumn And we walk through it Feeling gratitude for the grandeur

item.title: The Best Bakewell Basics
item.description: Sherry and nuts Tratan blanket Show ring dash Ducks on the river Make a splash Sunny days Chatting on the grass Derbyshire strolls Nothing flash Bakewell basic best We deserve the rest

item.title: Bank Holiday Monday
item.description: The day was grey I ran and it was windy Then we headed out to walk And we talked The green corn swished Cows and horse grazed A hawk hovered Nothing much was bothered In our passing by Still the clouds covered the sky. Sitting in a pub with pale ale A tin mug of pork scratchings An excited couple from London Visitors keen to chat This and that The beer, the building Next an elaborate woman in red Sat with a man sho spoke on his phone Of grouting tiles, smoking Sterling King Size She ate giant marshmallows Drank coffee and her name was Debbie.

item.title: Winter Walk
item.description: Dark hedgerows where scarlet berries hang Robins who stop to meet your eye Flocks of birds soaring high Pushing the clouds to reveal blue sky And as you walk many a mile Remember thereâ€™s been much that made you smile Two dogs hurtle by Proven loyalty makes you sigh A realisation in this open space Family and friends are yours to embrace
